title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
One point is earned for correctly drawing and labeling the force of tension and the force of friction for the Block

One point is earned for correctly drawing and labeling the normal force vector for the Block

One point is earned for correctly drawing and labeling the weight vector for the Block

One point is earned for correctly drawing and labeling both vertical vectors for the Hanging Object

Note: a maximum of three points can only be earned if there are any extraneous vectors
descriptions:
The student earns none of the following points:

One point is earned for correctly drawing and labeling the force of tension and the force of friction for the Block

One point is earned for correctly drawing and labeling the normal force vector for the Block

One point is earned for correctly drawing and labeling the weight vector for the Block

One point is earned for correctly drawing and labeling both vertical vectors for the Hanging Object

Note: a maximum of three points can only be earned if there are any extraneous vectors

The student earns one of the following points:

One point is earned for correctly drawing and labeling the force of tension and the force of friction for the Block

One point is earned for correctly drawing and labeling the normal force vector for the Block

One point is earned for correctly drawing and labeling the weight vector for the Block

One point is earned for correctly drawing and labeling both vertical vectors for the Hanging Object

Note: a maximum of three points can only be earned if there are any extraneous vectors

The student earns two of the following points:

One point is earned for correctly drawing and labeling the force of tension and the force of friction for the Block

One point is earned for correctly drawing and labeling the normal force vector for the Block

One point is earned for correctly drawing and labeling the weight vector for the Block

One point is earned for correctly drawing and labeling both vertical vectors for the Hanging Object

Note: a maximum of three points can only be earned if there are any extraneous vectors

The student earns three of the following points:

One point is earned for correctly drawing and labeling the force of tension and the force of friction for the Block

One point is earned for correctly drawing and labeling the normal force vector for the Block

One point is earned for correctly drawing and labeling the weight vector for the Block

One point is earned for correctly drawing and labeling both vertical vectors for the Hanging Object

Note: a maximum of three points can only be earned if there are any extraneous vectors

The student earns all of the following points:

One point is earned for correctly drawing and labeling the force of tension and the force of friction for the Block

One point is earned for correctly drawing and labeling the normal force vector for the Block

One point is earned for correctly drawing and labeling the weight vector for the Block

One point is earned for correctly drawing and labeling both vertical vectors for the Hanging Object

Note: a maximum of three points can only be earned if there are any extraneous vectors

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
One point is earned for a correct Newton’s 2nd law equation of the two-block system

mH g — FT = mH a = 0

FT — mB g sinθ — f = mB a = 0

or

mH g — mB g sinθ — f = (mH + mB) a = 0

One point is earned for setting the acceleration of the two-block system equal to zero either implicitly or explicitly

mH g — mB g sinθ — μk mB g sinθ = 0

One point is earned for a correct answer

mH = mB (sinθ + μk cosθ )

title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
• One point is earned for correctly applying Newton’s second law to the block

    — mB g sinθ — μk mB g cosθ = mB a

    — g (sinθ + μk cosθ) = a

    One point is earned for correctly substituting into the above equation

    a = — (9.8 m/s2) ((0.10) cos30 + sin30)

    One point is earned for a correct answer

    a = 5.75 m/s2 (Note: a = 5.87 m/s2 if g = 10 m/s2 is used)

  • One point is earned for selecting "Down the ramp"

  • One point is earned for a correct answer

    a = g = 9.81 m/s2 (Note: a = g = 10 m/s2 is also acceptable)

    Note: No work needs to be shown for this part

title: Part D
stimulusHtml:
One point is earned for using a correct kinematics equation for calculation the distance traveled by the block

One point in earned for using a correct statement of conservation of energy

KEi + Wf = PEf

One point is earned for converting h to d

h = dsinθ

One point is earned for a correct answer

d = 0.348 m (Note: d = 0.341 m if g = 10 m/s2 is used)
